text: This Mee Siam stall has been around for many years. Today, I happened to pass by and couldn't resist ordering a plate to satisfy my craving. One thing I appreciate about this Mee Siam is that the owner squeezes the lime into it for you, instead of the usual practice where they give you a lime to squeeze yourself. The Mee Siam is of the Nonya type, and it was as tasty as Nonya Mee Siam can get. One complaint was the small portion for the $4 plate.
Wanton noodle not bad. Heard their 五香also famous. Portion and ingredients quite generous. Will try again.

Sheng he fishball minced meat noodle.
The Vietnam auntie always fail her orders.
Always doesn’t listen to instructions.
Eat at your own risk! Spoil my appetite!

Ordered the fish porridge and fish soup with milk and rice.

One of the best soup base I have tasted in a long time. They are using Spanish mackerel for their fish and the meat is fresh to boot!

Worth the 15-20min wait especially during the meal times.
Fried beehoon has an unique taste, boss very friendly. After all these years, mee siam taste as good.
